item.title: Gold Breaks 2016 High in Japan… US to Follow?
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
The biggest news for the precious metals investors this week was not the gain in gold or silver, nor the continued weakness in the US dollar. The most important news for precious metals investors was the price increase of gold in Japanese yen terms. After several years of tight correlation, these markets are in the process of changing behavior, yet this important shift is still being largely ignored by the mainstream press. In early August (Part 1  – Part 2) we covered the historically tight correlation that has existed between the Japanese yen and gold prices dating back to 2011. If you did not have the opportunity to do so, please check out those posts for a better understanding of the analysis that follows.

Gold in Yen Breakout

This week, gold, as priced in Japanese yen, broke above its 2016 high in sudden fashion, rising from ¥141,300 per ounce to ¥146,095, a gain of 3.3%. The technical action is highlighted below:  We made the case in the past linked articles that a key determinant for a more significant precious metals advance in US dollar terms would be when the strong correlation between the Japanese yen and gold prices begins to break down. Below is the updated long-term ratio between yen and gold, which shows that the two have essentially acted as the same asset class as a net sum since 2011: To see the 2016 high for gold in yen exceeded this week tells us that the 6-year correlation is beginning to weaken. It is the breaking of this correlation which will eventually help gold to assume its proper role as safe-haven of last resort. We will look for a major advance at gold prices worldwide to correspond with a breaking of the lower (blue) trend line of the Japanese yen/gold ratio, which should begin with gold breaking above ¥151,000 per ounce, or a 3.5% further gain as priced in yen from last week’s close. This could occur within the next 2-3 weeks.

North Korea Fires Missile Over Japan… Tests Hydrogen Bomb

We never like to attribute one single cause to a market reaction. After all, the market is the sum of millions of distinct individuals, each acting upon their own unique beliefs, strengths, and fears. That said, it is likely that a portion of the movement into gold by Japanese investors this week was due to fears over North Korea. The latter is noted to have – for the first time ever – launched a ballistic missile directly over Japan, which then landed east off the coast in the Pacific Ocean. North Korea is subsequently reported to have tested a hydrogen bomb on Sunday. Tensions are certainly high between the United States, North Korea, and Japan, and while gold price spikes due to isolated geopolitical tensions are typically short-lived, those which foreshadow lengthy periods of conflict tend to be important early-warning indicators for more sustained price advances to develop throughout time. It is too early to say with any certainty how the current standoff between these nuclear powers will end, but by breaking above 2016 highs on the chart, gold priced in Japanese yen is signaling something important for those who would listen: the correlation between the two safe-havens is breaking… in favor of gold.

Takeaway on Gold

It is unlikely that the 6-year tight correlation will end in one week, but initial hints that this is in progress are plainly visible on the charts. We will continue to monitor this development at regular intervals for the foreseeable future. All asset correlations eventually change. When gold begins to advance in yen terms it signifies that the precious metal is picking up on new fundamentals, and set to be the safe-haven of last resort. For the upcoming week, we watch to see if gold can match its similar 2016 high in US dollar terms, which comes in at $1,378.     
Christopher Aaron, Bullion Exchanges Market Analyst Christopher Aaron has been trading in the commodity and financial markets since the early 2000's. He began his career as an intelligence analyst for the Central Intelligence Agency, where he specialized in the creation and interpretation of pattern-of-life mapping in Afghanistan and Iraq. Technical analysis shares many similarities with mapping: both are based on the observations of repeating and imbedded patterns in human nature. His strategy of blending behavioral and technical analysis has helped him and his clients to identify both long-term market cycles and short-term opportunities for profit. This article is provided as a third party analysis and does not necessarily matches views of Bullion Exchanges and should not be considered as financial advice in any way.

item.title: Ellis Island National Monument Coins Sold Out
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: On August 29, the US Mint issued its 2017 Ellis Island National Monument 5-ounce silver bullion coins. Three days later, all 40,000 had been sold. No additional coins of this design will be produced. This is the fourth release of five in the America the Beautiful Silver Coin Series of 2017. Still included in the inventory of the Philadelphia Mint is an undisclosed amount of 2016 Harpers Ferry National Park silver bullion coins. To date, 48,000 of these coins have been sold. The next in the series will be released to authorized purchasers on November 13th. This coin, the 40th issue out of the 56 of the ATB Coin Series, commemorates the George Rogers National Historical Park. A nod to Indiana, this coin features one of the greatest victories of the American Revolution, led by Colonel George Rogers Clark. Authorized purchasers both buy and sell bullion coins from the US Mint, in turn offering a two-way market. They are included in the approved buyers of American Eagle gold, silver, and platinum bullion coins, as well as American Buffalo gold bullion coins. Thus far this year, sales of 3-inch 5 ounce silver bullion coins have been decreasing, with 35,000 Effigy Mounds National Monument 5-ounce silver bullion coins sold and only 20,000 of the Frederick Douglass National Historic Site and Ozark National Scenic Railway purchased. Sales of the 2016 ATB releases numbered 105,000 for the Shawnee National Forest coin and 75,000 for the Cumberland Gap National Historical Park release. The sales of the releases made towards the end of the year were lower, at 40,000 for the Theodore Roosevelt National Park coin and 35,000 for the Fort Moultrie coin.

item.title: CFTC files $290 Million Lawsuit against Monex a Precious metals dealer
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
On September 6th, 2017, the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) accused a Newport Beach precious metals investment firm, Monex, of defrauding thousands of US customers with over $290 million by pulling off an illegal scheme of high-pressure sales tactics, leaving many senior clients without their life savings. *** When it comes to buying precious metals, it’s essential to do business with a trustworthy, reputable bullion dealer whose mission is to offer best prices, products, and services. Unfortunately, not all dealers provide secure and legal services and this recent CFTC law enforcement case highlights what to avoid when making precious metal investments.

CFTC Lawsuit Against Monex

The Federal regulator filed the civil lawsuit against California’s Monex in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois on Wednesday, September 6. In its complaint announcement-golded the alleged fraud “one of the largest precious metals” cases, it has ever filed since it involves over 12,000 accounts and holders and a time frame from July 2011 until March 2017. CFTC claims that Monex, owned by Louis and Michael Carabini (father and son) deceptively pitched leveraged trading through its so-called Atlas trading platform in which the company profited while customer losses were all but inevitable – the complaint cited several cases of elderly clients who lost over $100,000 each. The commission’s complaint focuses on off-exchange leveraged trades of silver, gold, platinum, and palladium performed by Monex clients using money borrowed through its Atlas platform. Although the alleged purpose of this trading platform was to allow retail customers to make investments by using the borrowed money, CFTC claims that Monex made most of its revenue by controlling the prices at which its clients bought and sold precious metals. The price difference (spread) between the underlying price on tracked spot markets and the price which Monex set was about 3%, which means, according to the cases cited in the complaint, it would cost the company’s clients $2,550 to trade 5,000 oz. of silver compared to a $25 cost to enter into a similar futures contract on a regulated exchange. Based on customers’ examples, CFTC alleged Monex for charging “outsized price spreads, commissions, interest on loans, and administrative fees.” Moreover, to boost its sales, Monex also deployed forceful TV campaigns and telephone sales which promised that its Atlas trading program was a secure and safe method of protecting customers’ wealth against inflation. Its employees involved in campaigns and sales were specially trained and used scripts that emphasized the investment’s “profit potential and security” – e.g. “If gold were to increase in value by $100 per ounce in the next year, and you had a 30% to 40% net gain, you’d feel pretty good, wouldn’t you?” Nonetheless, over 90% of all leveraged Atlas accounts and customers lost big and Monex is believed to have intentionally hidden this information from its prospects. Besides, the commission alleged that Monex’s sales agents were paid bonuses and commissions based on the number of accounts which they opened and their transaction volumes, not by client’s earnings. CFTC also accused the company’s owners, Louis Carabini (father) and Michael Carabini (son) of committing fraudulent activity and operating an illegal leveraged commodity platform which hasn’t been registered with the commission. The federal regulator also asked a judge to stop Monex from continuing to offer its Atlas platform trades to clients, seeking to have full restitution to harmed customers as well as disgorge any ill-gotten gains. On the other side, Monex issued a statement through which it denied any fraud allegations and stated that the terms of its Atlas trading program were publicly disclosed. The company also declared that it will vigorously defend the commission’s unwarranted action, disputing whether the federal regulator had any jurisdiction over the firm. However, this is not the first time the Carabinis or Monex have faced legal troubles. In 2004, Monex faced a class-action lawsuit that alleged the company in misleading its clients, resulting in a $150,000 payment to class members, while in 1974, Louis Carabini was accused by the Securities and Exchange Commission of obtaining $1 billion through deceptive sales of silver coins on margin.

Always Perform Due Diligence

Seemingly, there may be other similar precious metals companies or telemarketing firms which offer deceptive services or make forceful sales through home shopping TV shows. In most cases, they manage to convince the customers, mostly elderly clients, to make apparently a highly profitable investment while, in reality, ripping them off.   A previous eloquent and similar example is CFTC’s 2015 civil enforcement action filed against Andrew Kurzbard and its telemarketing company Guardian Asset Group, LLC which accused them of engaging in illegal, off-exchange precious metals transactions. The lawsuit ended with a consent order in May 2017 through which the now-defunct company and its owner were forced to pay restitution of $434,413.54 and a $651,620.31 civil monetary penalty and imposed them permanent trading and registration bans. Guardian and Kurzbard agreed to pay the civil penalty without denying or admitting the allegations. Therefore, choosing a reliable precious metal dealer is not easy, but it’s a critical decision either you already are an expert investor or just a new one. Luckily, the above lawsuits teach us about key signs that warn us about a potential illegal bullion business:
  • High-pressure sales and aggressive TV campaigns
  • Precious metal trading based on in-house loans
  • Unclear and confusing shipping policies, terms and conditions etc.
  • Expensive and ambiguous costs, fees, commissions etc.
  • Unallocated precious metals storage
  • Partial ownership in form of “gold units” or “shares”
Disclaimer: This post was written based on the official CFTC Press Release pr7609-17.

item.title: American Liberty 225th Anniversary Silver Four-Medal Set
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
Celebrating 225 years of coinage excellence, the US Mint will release on October, 19 this special Silver American Liberty 225th Anniversary 4-Medal Set featuring a breathtaking rendition of a renowned American icon - Lady Liberty. This beautiful four-medal set includes four  1 ounce coins made from .999 silver. All medals have the same design, but with special finishes and different mint mark:
  • The proof medal carries the S mint mark of San Francisco
  • The reverse proof medal carries the P mint mark of Philadelphia
  • The uncirculated medal carries the D mint mark of Denver
  • The enhanced uncirculated medal carries the W mint mark of West Point
Since the establishment of the United States Mint 225 years ago, various emblematic figures of Lady Liberty have graced the Nation’s beloved coins and medals. These superb medals showcase a modern representation of this iconic American figure that symbolizes freedom and equality - values set forth in the Declaration of Independence of the United States. The Lady Liberty is seen as an African-American woman, designed by Justin Kunz, meanwhile, the reverse shows an eagle in flight, designed by Chris Costello. Freedom, independence, and unity, the timeless values of the United States, - are all brought into one beautiful set. The US Mint announced that the product will be limited to a maximum release of 50,000 sets.

This set will be a unique and great addition to any collection. Get this special American Liberty 225th Anniversary Silver Four-Medal Set from Bullion Exchanges! You can also find the earlier US Mint 225th anniversary release - 2017 P 1 oz American Liberty High Relief Proof Silver Medal. This stunning medal is also available in graded versions.

item.title: Perth Mint presents the new 2018 Marvel Comics “Thor” Silver Bullion Coin.
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: This October, the internationally renowned Australian refinery, Perth Mint, presents a new Marvel's legendary comic character and one of the most important and powerful God in Norse mythology - Thor. The iconic hero created as a very cool rendition of the comic book Thor, not the portrayal for the Marvel Comics Universe movie franchise played by Chris Hemsworth, but the classic original look. The new design pictures Thor in action while holding his hammer- Mjolnir. The son of Odin and Fyorgyn - the Earth goddess, Thor is considered as the storm-weather God of sky and thunder, who also can fly. With a new Marvel movie -Thor Ragnarok coming in November this super-iconic character couldn’t possibly be a better subject for a coin series right now. According to Marvel movies, Thor Odinson is the prince of Asgard and a former member of Avengers; he was stripped of his power and banished by his father Odin to Earth. While being on Earth, Thor learned humanity and helped to save Asgard from his jealous adopted brother Loki. This is how he redeemed himself in the eyes of his father and was granted his power once again. After being welcomed back to Asgard as a hero, Thor joined the Avengers and fought with them against the Asgard enemies.     This amazing coin is the second release following the successful 2017 1 oz Tuvalu Spiderman Marvel series silver coin and takes this series to a whole other level, featuring the superhero team of the decade, The Avengers, from Marvel Comics. The 2018 1 oz Tuvalu Thor Marvel Series Silver Coin .9999 Fine Silver BU In Cap has a weight of 1 troy ounce and is struck from .9999 fine silver, having a brilliant uncirculated finish. This superb coin is Tuvalu legal tender, carrying a face value of $1 TVD, with its weight and purity backed by the Government of Tuvalu. The reverse side depicts the iconic Marvel hero, Thor, holding his hammer and framed by the mintmark and the inscriptions “Thor” and “Marvel,” while the obverse carries the well-known effigy of Queen Elizabeth II, surrounded by the engravings of her name, mintage year, and the coin’s weight, purity, and denomination.     This astounding piece is offered by the mint in its protective acrylic capsule and has a limited issue of just 50,000 coins. The coin is also offered in Rolls of 20, or lot of 100 which provides options for all levels of collectors and investors. Its limited mintage and incredibly detailed design resembling the legendary Thor make this spectacular piece a treasured addition to any portfolio and a fantastic gift for any Marvel fan. item.title: Increasing Palladium Prices: What’s Going On?
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: In a surprising turn of events, over the past two days, palladium has increased in price to the point of surpassing its more popular brother metal, platinum. 2017 has seen a steady surge in the price of palladium, and this month has pushed it higher than the price of platinum for the first time since January of 2001. There are a few factors that could be attributed to this climb. Palladium’s biggest customer is the automobile industry, an industry that makes up 80% of its demand. Carmakers use palladium in the making of catalytic converters for gasoline-powered and hybrid-electric vehicles, while platinum is used for diesel-powered vehicles. As consumers move more towards environmentally friendly vehicles, these hybrid cars are rising in demand as diesel vehicles falter. The scandal last year in Europe, where carmakers were found to be falsifying the emissions tests for their diesel vehicles, has further contributed to the decreasing demand for diesel-powered automobiles. This price parity could also be due to palladium’s largest producer, South Africa, whose currency (the rand) has seen a strong few years. As the rand strengthens, South Africa’s exports increase in price and this filters into a rising cost for this precious metal. Interestingly enough, 2017 is the first year when the US Mint has ever issued American Palladium Eagle, and this fact may also affect the increasing price of palladium. Following the Act passed by Congress in 2010 to create this coin, a third-party study commissioned by the Treasury Secretary was conducted to determine the demand it could generate. One finding of this study was concern about the unpredictability of the palladium market at the time, as it was relatively new on the scene and could be slotted into the industrial metals trade as opposed to precious metals. Ultimately, the enthusiasm of numismatists kept its release on track. Coincidentally or not, the Palladium Eagle has been released this year as the newest edition of one of the most popular coin series in the world, the American Eagle series. On Wednesday, platinum hit its lowest spot price in 16 years, with the price of one ounce of platinum buying .9901 ounces of palladium. Palladium was available on Wednesday for $919.50 an ounce, with platinum down to $917.49 an ounce. Thus far this year, palladium has increased 35% in price, with platinum at only a 2% increase at this point in 2017.

item.title: Bitcoin Hits All-Time High
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: Thursday saw an all-time high for bitcoin, setting a new record at $5316.86 at the time of writing. This year has seen regular growth for this form of cryptocurrency, with the previous all-time high hitting on September 2nd, at $5231.28. As of today, bitcoin has shown a 424% increase for 2017 to date and a 750% increase in the past year. Bitcoin started the year at $966 and is now worth more than four times the price of an ounce of gold. This record growth is attributed to the increase of interest shown by investors in cryptocurrency, whose total market cap has risen higher than $160 billion for the first time since early September. China’s banning of exchanges with cryptocurrency in September has caused caution for some, but most investors do not appear to be concerned. There have been new reports released this week stating that bitcoin trading in China may resume with stricter regulations. Russia is also working on regulation of the use of cryptocurrency, with President Vladimir Putin warning of “serious risks”. He tempered his warning with a refusal to throw up “too many barriers”, which may have helped bitcoin reach its high today. Even with the calls for regulation, cryptocurrency is gaining traction as a common currency, with even some property developers in London accepting rent payments from tenants through bitcoin. The Japanese government announced on September 29 that it was implementing regulations that would recognize bitcoin as an accepted payment method. Differing predictions come from economists, with some warning of a price bubble. Harvard professor of economics and public policy Kenneth Rogoff stated that while he predicts that cryptocurrency and its technology will continue to grow, the bitcoin itself could collapse.   This high was not unexpected, as the growth of bitcoin has been at more than $4800 this week, but marks a major achievement.

item.title: Updated Spring 2018 Product Release Schedule from US Mint
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
Ann Bailey, the Products Manager at United States Mint, presented the schedule for future product releases, which is now available on the US Mint’s official website. This presentation occurred during the United States Mint Forum in Washington D.C., with Bailey speaking as the Numismatic Program Manager. The following is a compilation of the upcoming release dates that were included in this presentation: At noon on January 4th the 2018 American Silver Eagle 1 oz coin in Proof from West Point will be available for purchase. If you are a bulk purchaser, you have the opportunity to take part in the new bulk pack program that was begun last year. Through this option, you will receive five trays of 42 Eagles in a special box, available on the same day as its release. This bulk option was very successful last year, and the Mint has announced that this option could be made available for the Burnished Proof or San Francisco Silver Eagle in the future. Seven days after this release, on January 11th, the Birth, Congratulations, and Happy Birthday Sets will come available. The Kennedy half dollar, Jefferson nickel, Roosevelt dime and Lincoln cent are included in the Birth and Happy Birthday sets in Proof version, bearing the S mint mark to denote the San Francisco mint. The Birth Set will also include the PIctured Rocks National Lakeshore quarter from Michigan, part of the America the Beautiful series, whose release will kick off the year for the series. The Happy Birthday set, contrastingly, will include the Rhode Island release which will conclude the series for 2018, the Block Island National Wildlife Refuge quarter from Rhode Island. A 2018-S Proof 1 oz Silver Eagle will come in the Congratulations Set. The following Wednesday, on January 17, the first commemorative coin of 2018 will be released: the World War I Veterans Centennial Uncirculated Silver Dollar. This coin will be available in Proof and Uncirculated options. Five additional coin and medal sets will be available for purchase on the same day, each representing a branch of the US Military that served during World War I: the Army, Navy, Coast Guard, Marines, and the Air Service Corps. The US Treasury stipulated that these medals could only be created to increase the sale of their coin counterparts, meaning that in order to purchase the entire set you will have to buy at least five World War I Veterans Centennial commemoratives. However, because the medals were struck with the same planchets and showcase exquisite designs, they will add value to any collection. January 23rd marks the release of the 2018 America the Beautiful Proof Set, which will include the San Francisco minted Proofs of 2018’s America the Beautiful quarter series: Michigan/Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, Wisconsin/Apostle Islands National Lakeshore, Minnesota/Voyageurs National Park, Georgia/Cumberland Island National Seashore, and the fifth and final release of the year, Rhode Island/Block Island National Wildlife Refuge. February will see the release of the American Platinum Eagle, whose theme of Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness stems from the Declaration of Independence. This three-coin series will break the mold of the previous 20 years’ worth of releases for its changing obverse designs that will share the same reverse eagle design. The 2018 release will showcase Lady Liberty on its obverse, her arms wrapped around a girl that is assumed to be her daughter. On February 8th the one-tenth ounce American Liberty gold Proof Coin will be released, with the same design as the 2017 gold release of this coin. This fractional version is available by popular demand, due to the high price of gold affecting the sale of the 2017 release. Jim Thorpe, the renowned Olympic football player, was the first Native American to win a gold medal in the Olympics. His achievements will be celebrated in the 2018 Native American $1 coin, available in rolls and bags on February 15th, with the Pictured Rocks quarter three-coin set available for purchase five days later. February 22nd marks the release of the 2018 America the Beautiful 90% Silver Proof Set. March will kick off with the 2018 American Gold Eagle line, and one ounce, half-ounce, quarter-ounce, and tenth-ounce Proof coins will be sold beginning on the first. The American Gold Eagle four-coin set will additionally be released on the first. Struck at the San Francisco Mint, the 2018 US Mint Proof Set will be released on the sixth of March. This set will include 2018’s five America the Beautiful Quarters in Proof, along with the Kennedy half-dollar, the Roosevelt dime, the Jefferson nickel, and the Lincoln cent, all of which are also in Proof versions. The second commemorative release of 2018 will come out on March 15th, the 2018 Breast Cancer Awareness commemorative, which will include $5 22-karat pink gold coin, silver $1 coins, and clad half-dollars, available in Proof and Uncirculated, making a total of six coins in this set. Five days later, on March 20th, 200-coin bags of the 2018 Kennedy half dollar and two-roll sets will be released. The 2018 America the Beautiful Uncirculated Set will be released on March 29th, capping off the spring releases announced thus far.

To Be Announced

A tentative schedule is available on the website for the rest of the 2018 releases from the US Mint. The 2018 American Buffalo one-ounce gold Proof coin will come out in spring, along with the Uncirculated 2018 Silver Eagle, Apostle Islands National Lakeshore rolls and bags, the three-coin set and five-ounce silver Uncirculated, and the 2018 US Mint Silver Proof and Uncirculated sets. Summer will see the one-ounce Uncirculated Gold Eagle, a 2018 San Francisco minted Silver Eagle Proof coin, Cumberland Island quarter products, the 2018 50th Anniversary San Francisco Silver Reverse Proof Set, and the Voyageurs National Park releases. In the fall, we will see the 2018 American Palladium Eagle Proof Coin, the ATB Circulating Coin Set, Block Island quarter releases, the 2018 Limited Edition Silver Proof Set, and the Breast Cancer Awareness Coin and Stamp Set.

item.title: New Zealand Mint Celebrates Year of the Dog
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: 2018 is the Year of the Dog on the Lunar Calendar, and the New Zealand Mint offers an excellent way to commemorate it. If you are a Disney fan and were born in the Year of the Dog, then this 2018 1 oz Niue Silver $2 Disney Year of the Dog was tailor-made just for you! The eleventh animal in the 12-year Lunar cycle, those born in the Year of the Dog are thought to be loyal, clever, brave, and energetic. They share their Chinese Zodiac sign with well-known figures such as Benjamin Franklin, Ellen Degeneres, and Prince William. Their lucky colors are said to be red, green, and purple and the prediction for their lucky days next year are the 7th and 28th of every Chinese lunar month.               The New Zealand Mint has crafted a licensed Disney image to showcase on their commemorative Year of the Dog coin. The reverse features the iconic Mickey Mouse character, grinning and posing with a stylized dog, with flowers and the Chinese character for dog around them. The bottom edge is engraved with the coin’s weight and purity, along with the Disney copyright that ensures the coin’s authenticity. The obverse holds a portrait of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, inscribed with the date and the coin’s face value. This coin is crafted with 1 oz of .999 fine silver and comes in a plastic flip. Lot of 25 come in mint-issued tubes and lots of 250 come in a mint-issued monster box. Order this stunning coin, and a must-have for Disney lovers or those born in the Year of the Dog, today!

item.title: New 2018 Kangaroo Release from Perth Mint
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
The 2018 release of popular Perth Mint Gold Kangaroo series is now available at Bullion Exchanges. This annual Perth Mint released series has featured many remarkable editions, including the largest, heaviest, and highest valued gold bullion coin in the world, which came out in 2011. The mint has provided coins of many different sizes, making them available for investors of all budgets. Struck from the finest precious metals, each is recognized as legal tender of Australia. The red kangaroo is well-known as the national animal of Australia and has become a popular icon for the country. All coins in this series showcase different depictions of the classic design of the bounding, sun-kissed marsupial, created by Stuart Devlin. The coins carry the “P” mintmark and additionally have a specially designed, micro-engraved letter only detectable under a magnifying glass. The obverse shows the globally recognized portrait of Queen Elizabeth II, designed by Ian Rank-Broadley.

First-ever Australian Platinum Kangaroo

For more than two decades, the only version of the Australian Kangaroo available for purchase was the gold coin. In 2016, Perth Mint added a silver coin to the series for the first time, and now in 2017 there is first-ever - 2018 1 oz Australian Platinum Kangaroo.  Meanwhile, the popular and highly anticipated gold coin is available in 1 oz, ½ oz, ¼ oz, and 1/10 oz options, making them an excellent choice for those looking to invest in the series on a budget or for those looking to diversify their portfolio.  Purchase this coin today through Bullion Exchanges, a leading precious metals retailer in the New York City Diamond District. If you have any questions, give us a call at 800.852.6884, reach us by email at customerservice@bullionexchanges.com, or connect with us via our convenient web portal.

item.title: ScotiaMocatta Scandal Gaining Steam
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: The world’s oldest gold trader, ScotiaMocatta, which has roots dating back to the 17th century, went on sale on Wednesday, the decision stemming from a scandal that has shocked the global bullion market. Mocatta Bullion was purchased by Scotiabank in 1997 and has existed since 1671. News outlets have been following the massive money laundering charges that have come to light and will most certainly have a huge effect in some of the biggest players in the business. The Canada Bank of Nova Scotia has been testing the waters on finding a buyer for its gold business- ScotiaMocatta. This money laundering story, that a US refinery was part of a smuggling of gold from South America, has greatly affected many and has left the future of ScotiaMocatta very uncertain over the past few months. ScotiaBank may even have been searching for a buyer for close to a year and has been decreasing its business in case a sale doesn’t go through soon. JPMorgan has been put in charge of the sale of this mainstay in precious metals trading, and they seem to be eyeing China as a potential buyer at this time. March sealed this sale, when Scotiabank made a loan to Elemental, a refinery in Texas, and set itself apart as one of their biggest lenders. When US prosecutors subsequently accused NTR Metals, a subsidiary of Elemental, of laundering billions of dollars of criminal gold, most of which came from Peru, Scotiabank’s fate was decided. This story has garnered a lot of interest because of its slightly surreal aspects, like the fact that this Elemental subsidiary allegedly imported more than 3.6 billion dollars of gold from Latin America in the four year time period of 2012 to 2015. Two men involved, Samer Barrage and Juan Granda, pled guilty in September to money laundering plea deals. Following this, Elemental was booted from the London Bullion Market Association's “Good Delivery List” of gold refiners. It’s hard to come back from being removed from this list, as gold buyers tend to only buy gold from those that are part of it. Shortly after Elemental was removed, the Comex futures exchange in New York announced that it would no longer accept gold from Elemental for delivery against futures contracts. This announcement along with the rising tide of scandal made it impossible for those with Elemental gold to sell their gold bars, leaving them stuck in banks, stated traders in the Financial Times. Buyers are also hesitant to take on any of this gold. Because of this, hundreds of millions of dollars in loans given to Elemental from ScotiaMocatta are left in limbo. Additionally, one of the five bullion banks that work in gold with the largest market, London, has been blackballed. HSBC and JPMorgan are prepared to step into Mocatta’s empty spot on the London market with their ability to provide credit to clients and refiners worldwide. They also provide an additional benefit that Scotiabank could not, which are their London vaults. The London gold market is estimated at approximately 5 trillion dollars a year, even though no exact number of how much gold is traded daily is available. Scotiabank has the largest foreign presence of any Canadian bank and is currently looking towards the Pacific Alliance, a Latin American trade bloc made up of Mexico, Peru, Chile, and Colombia. For now, it will continue to look for a Chinese buyer for this compromised gold trading operation.

item.title: New Piece of Platinum Proof Series Announced by US Mint
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: Inspired by the Declaration of Independence, a three-year program entitled “Preamble to the Declaration of Independence Platinum Proof Coin Series” was announced yesterday. This series will begin in 2018 and will feature one-ounce proof coins of 99.95% platinum with new, updated designs. Proof coins go through a specialized minting process, where first burnished coin blanks are fitted into presses with special dies. The coin goes through multiple strikes which achieves a floating image effect over a mirrored field. Inspectors then scrutinize the quality of each coin before placing them in a protective plastic capsule and mounting them in a satin-lined velvet case. These coins will come along with an official Certificate of Authenticity and sell at a fixed price. The $100 face value of the American Eagle Platinum Proof Coin sets it apart as the highest denomination of any US legal tender coin. The US Mint has also made available uncirculated versions of the gold and silver American Eagles for collectors, which feature the same designs as the proof versions. Uncirculated coins can be distinguished by their mint marks which show where they were minted. They undergo minting in burnished coin blanks, which are fed one by one by hand into specifically adapted presses. These coins are also carefully inspected before they are put into a protective plastic and then within a box. A Certificate of Authenticity accompanies each of these coins. The American Eagle One Ounce Platinum Proof Coin was first released in 1997 and has always featured the same obverse, a Liberty portrait. The reverse has cycled through different themes, including “Vistas of Liberty”, “Foundations of Democracy”, “The Preamble to the Constitution”, and “Torches of Liberty”. The third decade of this program will see updated obverse designs concurrently designed by the same person, Justin Kunz, along with a new shared reverse design. This series has been designed to reflect the foundation of American principles of life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness, as listed in the Preamble to the Declaration of Independence. The 2018 release carries the Life theme and showcases Lady Liberty planting seeds in a field alongside a child. She carries a sword to symbolize the defense of life. The field around her symbolizes the labor and thought necessary to sustain life. The tree and stream in the background portray nature and the importance of being a good steward of the environment around us. The obverse of this coin is inscribed with “LIFE”, “IN GOD WE TRUST”, “E PLURIBUS UNUM”, “LIBERTY”, and the year of mintage.   The 2019 release celebrates Liberty and features Lady Liberty standing tall over prairies, lakes, and mountains. The rough terrain in the background calls on the American spirit of exploration and the freedom to search for new places, ideas, and ways of life. Lady Liberty’s lips are parted, symbolizing freedom of speech, and the torch she carries acts as a guiding light. She also holds a book to show the need for law and equality. The obverse will be inscribed with “LIBERTY”, “IN GOD WE TRUST”, “E PLURIBUS UNUM”, and “2019”. The 2020 release commemorates the third and final American principle, the Pursuit of Happiness. This coin shows Lady Liberty at work harvesting a rich bounty with a girl at her side. Her bounty symbolizes that which liberty makes possible. The buildings standing behind her symbolize the American path, and the final step of the story shown throughout the series- from the furrowed field to mountains to home and farm. The representative of the hard work and ingenuity needed for success, this third coin wraps up the series. The obverse will carry the inscriptions “HAPPINESS”, “IN GOD WE TRUST”, “E PLURIBUS UNUM”, “LIBERTY”, and the year of mintage. All will share a reverse design of an eagle soaring with an olive branch gripped in its talons, crafted by AIP Designer Patricia Lucas-Morris. They will all be composed of 99.95% platinum and will carry the “W” mintmark. You can follow us on social media or subscribe to our newsletter for getting all additional information on this program.

item.title: Bitcoin Hits $6,500 High for the first time ever.
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: Wednesday saw an all-time high for bitcoin, setting a new record at $6500.00 at the time of writing. Bitcoin has been continually posting record highs of late, breaking through $5,300 level, but Wednesday's rise appears to be a new record, based on the price of bitcoin across the US, Japan, South Korea, and Europe. Traders suggest this jump was caused by news that the exchange operator CME Group was planning to introduce bitcoin futures. This year the price rise has been driven by increasing mainstream adoption and awareness of bitcoin and cryptocurrencies more generally. At least 55 cryptocurrency hedge funds have sprung up this year, many of them focusing on bitcoin.  Bitcoin has been rising by over 500% against the dollar this year. However, traders suggest that the main factors affecting Bitcoin surrounding the possibility of the Chinese government, resuming cryptocurrency trading after the reelection of President Xi Jinping later this year, and the strong performance of the Japanese market have contributed to the price surge of bitcoin over the past weeks. Bitcoin traders are also speculating that this week's bull run is partly helped by a new coming "fork" in bitcoin's underlying software. Differing predictions come from economists, but now may be a good time to report that bitcoin has had a great year. Sure, there have been some ups and downs, but bitcoin has been the clear winner. Furthermore, there have been increasing uses of bitcoin as legal tender around the world, and this trend would lead to hundreds of billions of dollars being allocated into bitcoin in the upcoming years and will allow bitcoin to achieve new highs. This article does not constitute financial advice, which can only be provided by a certified financial adviser.

item.title: Central Bank Shake-Ups Around the World
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded:
Although we are primarily focused here on gold as priced in US dollars – as this remains the standard by which international traders and mining companies mark their assets – we remain cognizant that a worldwide movement of capital into precious metals is what will account for the bull market that we believe is just in the beginning stages of developing. Thus we look elsewhere around the globe periodically. This past week the Bank of England under Governor Mark Carney raised interest rates by 0.25% to a new mark of 0.50%. While the fact that this was the first interest rate hike in the UK in 10 years is getting most of the mainstream attention, what is not being highlighted is that interest rates still remain at the lowest levels ever recorded in the British monetary system. Below we show the Bank of England prime rate from the abolishment of the Bretton Woods gold standard in 1971 (when currencies were allowed to float freely versus the US dollar) through the present: [caption id="attachment_2979" align="aligncenter" width="737"] Interest rates rise to 0.5%[/caption] We must also note: not only have interest rates been held lower from 2007 through present than any time in modern history, but they have also remained lower than the rate the Bank of England set during World War II (2.0%). Can we truly fathom that England’s banking authorities deemed the nation’s economy to be in worse condition over the past 10 years than during the deadliest conflict in all of human history? Such is the unprecedented nature of the time we live in. Those new to central banking should know that the controlling organization does not simply have a lever to pull to lower interest rates at will. No – central banks must continually print money to buy short-term bonds in order to keep interest rates suppressed below the level at which the market would naturally set. This is a principal reason why low-interest rates are inflationary: money is continually being created each month as the central banks hold rates down. It should be no surprise then that M3 money supply in the UK – the broadest measure of the total quantity of British pounds in existence – has nearly doubled since 2007, and indeed, is up over 5-fold since 1992:

Trump Nominates Powell

Meanwhile on the other side of the Atlantic, President Trump this past week has finalized his nomination for new Federal Reserve chair: Jerome Powell. In recent weeks we covered how – if Powell is indeed confirmed – current chairwoman Yellen will have been “terminated” after the shortest tenure as Fed chair since G. William Miller presided over the highest inflation rate (14%) in US history in the late 1970’s. What more, Powell was originally selected as a Fed governor under the Obama administration, thus showing us that when it comes to central banking, the Democrat /Republican divide exists in name only: Janet Yellen “should be ashamed of herself” for creating “a false stock market” [by keeping interest rates low]. -Donald Trump, September 2016. “I do like the low-interest rate policy… I have a lot of respect” [for Yellen]. -Donald Trump, July 2017. The bottom line in central banking is: support primarily exists for Fed member banks at all costs. Everything else – consumer price inflation, unemployment, the value of the currency – comes secondarily. Most major markets were little changed on Thursday / Friday on the news that Yellen will be replaced by Powell – indicating that the status quo of sufficient money-printing to maintain the solvency of member banks will remain in place even when the new chair takes office in February 2018.

Gold Price Update

Gold remains in the midst of its long-term downtrend retest zone. For the week, the historic store of wealth finished lower by a fraction, down 0.2% or $3 to finish at $1,269 as of the final trade on the New York COMEX on Friday afternoon. As precious metals investors, we must primarily focus on the main gold chart at all times, and nothing about the technical action over the past week has changed the fact that a 6-year downtrend (magenta line) is now in the process of retesting its breakout point. Gold is attempting to establish a new trend. We must let this retesting process play out: [caption id="attachment_2982" align="aligncenter" width="549"] Gold 2011-2017[/caption]  
Christopher Aaron, Bullion Exchanges Market Analyst Christopher Aaron has been trading in the commodity and financial markets since the early 2000's. He began his career as an intelligence analyst for the Central Intelligence Agency, where he specialized in the creation and interpretation of pattern-of-life mapping in Afghanistan and Iraq. Technical analysis shares many similarities with mapping: both are based on the observations of repeating and imbedded patterns in human nature. His strategy of blending behavioral and technical analysis has helped him and his clients to identify both long-term market cycles and short-term opportunities for profit. This article is provided as a third party analysis and does not necessarily matches views of Bullion Exchanges and should not be considered as financial advice in any way.

item.title: New release from the Royal Canadian Mint - 2018 Gold & Silver Maple Leafs
item.dc:creator: juliap
item.content:encoded: The Royal Canadian Mint introduced a new stunning release of the renowned Gold Maple Leaf and Silver Maple Leaf coins. Stuck from .9999 pure gold and .9999 pure silver, these coins are considered as one of the most beautiful bullion on the market. Gold Maple Leafs come in a variety of sizes and denominations(1 oz., 1⁄2 oz., 1⁄4 oz., 1⁄10 oz., 1⁄20 oz., 1 gram), making them affordable to any level of investor and collector. Silver Maple Leafs are known for having the highest silver content, that also makes them a great way to invest in silver bullion while adding collectibility to each investment. The Maple Leaf coins have always been highly appreciated for their stunning design and the highest manufacturing quality. The coins' reverse depicts the maple leaf - a national symbol of Canada, along with engravings of the country name, coin size, and gold purity. The coins' obverse presents the right-profile of Queen Elisabeth II with the inscriptions of coin's face value, year of mintage and Queen’ name.   Besides, their iconic design and characteristics, the Canadian Maple Leaf coins are famous for their security features, and the 2018 release is not an exception. These coins offer the highest security on the market, by including uniquely designed marks on the coin’s reverse. Each coin depicts a security mark - a small textured maple leaf, micro-engraved with laser technology. Each micro-engraving is encoded, scanned and recorded at the mint for future authentication giving each Maple Leaf its authenticity. The Bullion DNA program is considered as one of the highest security programs on the market nowadays. Individual Silver Canadian Maple Leafs come in plastic flips, and Individual Gold Canadian Maple Leafs come sealed in plastic.These coins are legal tender in Canada and one of the most desirable coins on the international market. The Maple Leaf coins are a must-have addition to any precious metals collection. Make sure to order these amazing  2018 1 oz Silver Canadian Maple Leaf .9999 Fine $5 Coin and 2018 1 oz Canadian Gold Maple Leaf $50 Coin .9999 Fine before they are sold out.
